meanings.definition: To drive away or urge to move by or as if by shouting or whistling.
meanings.sent1: The farmer shoos the birds from his crops.
meanings.sent2: She shoos the cat out of the room when she needs to clean.
meanings.sent3: The children giggle as they try to shoos away the pesky flies.
meanings.sent4: The coach shoos the players towards victory with his motivational speeches.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the car engine shoos the deer away from the road.

meanings.definition: To move, go, or take out by or as if by shooing.
meanings.sent1: The waiter shoos the customers to their reserved table.
meanings.sent2: He shoos the dog out of the kitchen before preparing dinner.
meanings.sent3: The wind gently shoos the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent4: The waves shoos the seashells onto the sandy shore.
meanings.sent5: The broom shoos the dust bunnies out from under the bed.
